Text.content:
There are three example React applications available here that give application developers a quick introduction to how the JSON API works. Demo 1 is the hello world of the JSON API. It introduces to how content can be retrieved in OpenCms by means of the virtual file system. Demo 2 explains how lists with news items compiled by editors according to certain filter criteria can be retrieved dynamically. Demo 3 illustrates how content for which there are individual formatting settings can be read and displayed.

The demos in no way represent a real-world use case. They are kept as short and simple examples to introduce to the JSON API. The React source code is available online. It contains useful comments about technical details. Additionally, there is a API documentation available that explains the features of the JSON API in detail.
